intro: Echinorhyncha vollesii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its thick, fleshy leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a perennial herb, often with a short, thick stem and rosettes of leaves. Its flowers are usually violet or purple in color, and it is popular as an ornamental plant due to its beauty and ease of cultivation. Echinorhyncha vollesii prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil to thrive.
